Articles.Content:
[WARNING] Do Not Attempt This Challenge If Your KSP is really laggy

Well, you know that ships in KSP are actually .craft files and they take up a few KB of space right?

My challenge is to make a ship where it's craft file takes a (at least) 1 MB of space.

Even a 100 KB craft lagged my KSP to 2fps, so, please try not to launch the craft(if you want to you can but i wont be held responsible for any damage caused)

Rules:

1.Must be completely stock.

2.Can be built in VAB or SPH

3.All I need is a screenshot of the .craft file and its memory useage.

4.I do not need a screen shot of the actual craft in game, because its probably gonna bring KSP down to 0.01fps

5.No stolen craft

6.Have Fun:)
How can I have fun knowing it's a pointless joyless competition of system spec and how long you can click stuff holding down the alt button?
I'm tempted to post a screenshot showing 2001 - A Space Odyssey.craft
Have you read over the Challenge Submission Guidelines? http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24898-Challenge-Submission-Guide
haha, my Cira VI + Laythe base is 2MB XD It's 1600 parts... and it's fully functional (albet a 5 minute launch takes 45 minutes...)

*summons Zekes*

I'm annoyed that I've got one sitting at a bit under 1000KB(960 to be exact). Damn my efficient constructions.

EDIT: *time travel summons Zekes*

I have two contenders, both capable of murdering most computers.

KDX-III

KDX-III Space Defense (Not the SM-III edition)

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Does it fly like in anime?

Does it fly like in anime?

Only if you really want it to...

No really. I could probably make it fly, but only whackjob could handle the lag while making it. The VTOL trial and error would be horrifically slow. :)

*summons Zekes*

I'm annoyed that I've got one sitting at a bit under 1000KB(960 to be exact). Damn my efficient constructions.

EDIT: *time travel summons Zekes*

lol

EDIT: Here are my top ten heavy craft (that I released):

Wales Class Battlecruiser - 1MB

QEII Battleship (994KB)

Edited November 27, 2014 by zekes
My largest is the HMS Vanguard, but she's just 504 mb.

My largest is the HMS Vanguard, but she's just 504 mb.

it's not always part count; some parts are bigger filewize than others, due to abilities, action groups, and tweakables.
It should be quite clear who's winning...
Did I miss something? Did Whackjob get replaced?
Well my largest is my Perigrine Class carrier but its only 260KB so...yeh
All that surface area (and shy of 1400 parts) and only 836KB.

I never built a ship based on that specification checking my folder only one qualifies:

Its a lorry that was designed to mine kethane from minmus. Somehow ended up a 75 tonne (full) reuseable SSTO once landed on minmus.

http://cloud-4.steampowered.com/ugc/39732810377341230/32DEF3FA14BFE17CE03B7C38AE2F331F3B31BC2F/

http://cloud-4.steampowered.com/ugc/39732810399676439/3953B5B8A565E7F65AF276490E665F3BA6AC10F8/

The ship from my attempt at the Jool-5 challenge. 1333 parts on the launchpad. Not as big as Zekes's, but still the biggest ship I've ever built. But I know that there's bigger out there.

WHACKJOB, I SUMMON THEE.
